title: MGM Resorts pledges $1 million to LA wildfire relief, matching employee donations
text: {p}{ } Proof of concept AI assistant.{/p}{p}After Wynn Las Vegas, MGM Resorts announced that they are donating $1 million to support relief efforts for the wildfires in Los Angeles. {/p}{p}This donation will be allocated to both the American Red Cross and the Los Angeles Fire Department Foundation. {/p}{p}Additionally, MGM Resorts is collaborating with multiple organizations on the ground that provide shelter, food, and financial assistance to the victims.{/p}{p}MGM Resorts encourages its employees to contribute to the relief efforts and has pledged to match these contributions dollar for dollar.{/p}{p}Furthermore, MGM Resorts properties are offering a 35% discount for those affected by the wildfires, subject to availability, and they are ensuring flexibility for cancellations due to impacted travel.{/p}{p}{br}{/p}{p}HEADLINE: Chilly night ahead{/p}{p}LOW TODAY: 43{ } { } NORMAL LOW: 40{/p}{p}HIGH TODAY: 60{ } NORMAL HIGH: 58{/p}{p}Winds will continue to relax overnight, but those temperatures will be quite chilly with a forecast low of 37 for Las Vegas.{/p}{p}Friday looks great, but a little on the cool side with a high of 56.{/p}{p}Tomorrow will be the first time since December 11th that high temperatures will be below normal.{/p}{p}Breezy conditions return on Saturday ahead of a strong cold front that will move through early Sunday morning.{/p}{p}No precipitation once again with this system, but some of the coldest temperatures of the season will arrive Sunday and will continue through next Tuesday.{/p}{p}As of midnight tonight, Las Vegas will be 180 days in a row without measurable rain.{/p}{p}NO SMOKE FROM SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA WILDFIRES AS WINDS REMAIN OFFSHORE.{/p}{p}Severe to extreme drought conditions remain across ALL of southern Nevada.
